  • |Table attributes
  • Latest release: 0.9.0

Table attributes

Description


The <table> attributes allow to set the main options for the table, ie sorting, filtering, theme activation, …

Don't forget to add the prefix dt: before each attribute.


Usage

<table dt:table="true" ...>
   ...
</table>

Reference

Name Description Value(s) Default Data source
dt:table (required) Enables DataTables4j in a Thymeleaf template. The value must be true true|false DOM/AJAX
dt:url Web service URL used to populate the table AJAX
dt:appear Display mode used when the table has finished loading and must appear in the page. A duration can be set (in milliseconds) if the display mode is set to "fadein" block|fadein[,duration] DOM/AJAX
dt:cdn Enable the DataTables source files to be loaded from the Microsoft CDN (Content Delivery Framework) preventing you from hosting the files yourself. true|false false DOM/AJAX
dt:info Enable or disable the table information display. This shows information about the data that is currently visible on the page, including information about filtered data if that action is being performed true|false true DOM/AJAX
dt:paginate Enable or disable pagination true|false true DOM/AJAX
dt:filter Enable or disable filtering of data true|false true DOM/AJAX
dt:sort Enable or disable sorting of columns. Sorting of individual columns can be disabled by the "sortable" attribute of column tag true|false true DOM/AJAX
dt:autowidth Enable or disable automatic column width calculation true|false true DOM/AJAX
dt:displaylength Number of rows to display on a single page when using pagination 10 DOM/AJAX
dt:paginationtype Choice between the different built-in pagination interaction methods which present different page controls to the end user two_button|
full_numbers|
four_button|
bootstrap|
scrolling|
input|
listbox|
extJs		 two_button DOM/AJAX
dt:export Enable or disable the export functionality true|false false DOM
dt:theme Name of a theme to activate for the current table bootstrap2|jqueryui DOM/AJAX
dt:themeOption Name of an option to activate in relation to the current activated theme. DOM/AJAX
dt:labels Relative URL of an AJAX loaded file which contains all the labels used in tables. DOM/AJAX
dt:serverside Tell DataTables to use server-side processing. true|false false AJAX
dt:pipelining Enable pipelining data for paging when server-side processing is enabled. true|false false AJAX
dt:pipesize Pipe size used when pipelining is enabled, i.e. times that the user can page before a request must be made of the server. 5 AJAX
dt:processing Enable or disable the display of a 'processing' indicator when the table is being processed (e.g. a sort). This is particularly useful for tables with large amounts of data where it can take a noticeable amount of time to sort the entries true|false false AJAX
dt:exportLinks Comma-separated list of positions where the export links will be generated top_left|
top_middle|
top_right|
bottom_left|
bottom_middle|
bottom_right		 top_right DOM
dt:lengthmenu Specify the entries in the length drop down menu that DataTables show when pagination is enabled. DOM/AJAX
dt:serverdata This parameter allows you to override the default function which obtains the data from the server ($.getJSON) so something more suitable for your application AJAX
dt:serverparams Allows you to send extra information to the server when using AJAX source AJAX
dt:stripeclasses Comma-separated list of CSS classes that should be applied to displayed rows. This sequence of CSS classes may be of any length, and DataTables will apply each class sequentially, looping when required. DOM/AJAX
dt:scrolly (scroller) Table's height to display in scrolling mode. 300px DOM/AJAX
dt:scrollcollapse When vertical (y) scrolling is enabled, DataTables will force the height of the table's viewport to the given height at all times (useful for layout). However, this can look odd when filtering data down to a small data set, and the footer is left "floating" further down. This parameter (when enabled) will cause DataTables to collapse the table's viewport down when the result set will fit within the given Y height. true|false false DOM/AJAX
dt:dom Allows you to specify exactly where in the DOM you want DataTables to inject the various controls it adds to the page (for example you might want the pagination controls at the top of the table). DIV elements (with or without a custom class) can also be added to aid styling. lfrtip DOM/AJAX
